thread.title: WATCH: Papa Roach, Pop Evil, others discuss their favorite horror movies at Monster Energy Rock Allegiance
thread.title_full: WATCH: Papa Roach, Pop Evil, others discuss their favorite horror movies at Monster Energy Rock Allegiance | NJ.com

author: Kelly Roncace | For NJ.com
title: WATCH: Papa Roach, Pop Evil, others discuss their favorite horror movies at Monster Energy Rock Allegiance
text:
Rockstars At Rock Allegiance Tell What Horror Movie Is Their Favorite, Oct. 10, 2015 In honor of the Halloween season, rockers from Butcher Babies, Pop Evil, Papa Roach, and Nothing More discuss their favorite horror movies backstage at Monster Energy Rock Allegiance.
Heavy metal music and the horror film genre often go hand in hand.
So, in honor of the Halloween season, band members from Butcher Babies, Pop Evil, Papa Roach, and Nothing More sat down to discuss their favorite scary movies while backstage at the Monster Energy Rock Allegiance music festival held at PPL Park in Chester, Pennsylvania, on Oct. 10.
From "Pan's Labyrinth" to the original "Texas Chainsaw Massacre" to the 1922 classic "Nosferatu," this eclectic group of musicians covered all the creepy bases.
Heidi Shepherd and Carla Harvey, front women of Butcher Babies, list Rob Zombie's "House of 1,000 Corpses" and the sequel, "The Devil's Rejects" as artistic influences in their career.
However, they didn't name them as their all-time favorites, even though the Zombie films do rank up their in their most beloved.
"I have a hard time picking a favorite horror film though," Shepherd said. Because that's my favorite genre. I can't pick just one. It's like ice cream."
